#if !defined … #define … #endif.description: The #define directive allows the definition of macros within your source code. These macro definitions allow constant values to be declared for use throughout your code.

#include \"…\".description: The #include directive tells the preprocessor to insert the contents of another file into the source code at the point where the #include directive is found.

#include <…>.description: The #include directive tells the preprocessor to insert the contents of another file into the source code at the point where the #include directive is found.
